data.title: Official Double Master's Degree in Legal Profession + Logistics and International Trade
data.text:
The Official Double Master's in Legal Profession + Logistics and International Trade is aimed at training people to deliver excellent service in legal practice in their various pre-litigious and litigious specialities, as well as corporate legal consultancy for a diverse range of organisations.

It also offers advanced training to experts in logistics, transport and international trade. They will be able to lead supply chain management and logistics, optimise transport to reduce time, costs and environmental impact, and lead the international projects of their organisations.

The double master's has the following specific objectives:

Legal Profession:

- To acquire the knowledge and skills to apply European law in the framework of legal practice, both in Spain and on the international scale.

- To be able to use the Spanish legal system and execute legal advice, defence, prosecution, mediation and more as a lawyer.

- To develop analytical and negotiation skills in conflict resolution.

- To have a good understanding of techniques to use in trial to get the best results.

- To understand the procedural laws and evaluate, critique, discuss, create and present judicial proposals related to real cases.

- To learn the basic skills needed to manage a professional lawyer's office.

- To understand the ethics of the legal profession.

Logistics and International Trade:

- To identify international supply chains on a global, continental and regional scale.

- To prepare students to control and manage a logistic chain and its integrated processes and subprocesses, as well as the associated transport operations.

- To train students in optimum negotiation and recruitment skills for transport and logistics, following expected profitability criteria.

- To teach the technical and operational aspects of each mode of transport and their operators on a global, continental, regional and local scale.

- To discover the purpose and characteristics of transport and logistical support infrastructures, as well as the main maritime logistics hubs.

- To learn about and understand new international markets and the flow of goods they generate, as well as identifying businesses opportunities within any given field.

- To teach students how to design, develop and implement company internationalisation projects.

- To analyse country risk and security for supply chains to establish new international businesses.

- To learn about all the key players in international trade, importation and exportation and documentation that goes with and certifies every process.

- To apply corporate social responsibility in all activities, both your own policy as well as those of providers and clients.
